verses.text: She who being a widow has not made choice of a worldly life, is a widow indeed; she who trusts in God as she ought, and continues instant in prayer night and day, is a widow indeed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:109
verses.text: Not that she, who has children, is not a widow indeed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:110
verses.text: For he commends her who brings up children as she ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:111
verses.text: But if any one has not children, he means, she is desolate, and her he consoles, saying, that she is most truly a widow, who has lost not only the consolation of a husband, but that arising from children, yet she has God in the place of all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:112
verses.text: She is not the worse for not having children, but He fills up her need with consolation, in that she is without children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:113
verses.text: What he says amounts to this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:114
verses.text: Grieve not, when it is said that a widow ought to bring up children, as if, because thou hast no children thy worth were on that account inferior.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:115
verses.text: Thou art a widow indeed, whereas she who liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:116
verses.text: But since many who have children choose the state of widowhood, not to cut off the occasions of a worldly life, but rather to enhance them, that they may do what they will with the greater license, and indulge the more freely in worldly lusts: therefore he says, "She that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:117
verses.text: Ought not a widow then to live in pleasure? Surely not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:118
verses.text: If then when nature and age is weak, a life of pleasure is not allowable, but leads to death, eternal death; what have men to say, who live a life of pleasure? But he says with reason, "She that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:119
verses.text: But that thou mayest see this, let us now see what is the state of the dead, and what of the living, and in which shall we place such an one? The living perform the works of life, of that future life, which is truly life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:120
verses.text: And Christ has declared what are the works of that future life, with which we ought always to be occupied.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:121
verses.text: "Come, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:122
verses.text: For I was an hungered, and ye gave me meat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:123
verses.text: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:124
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:125
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:127
verses.text: ) The living differ from the dead, not only in that they behold the sun, and breathe the air, but in that they are doing some good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:128
verses.text: For if this be wanting, the living are not better than the dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:129
verses.text: That you may learn this, hear how it is possible that even the dead should live.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:130
verses.text: For it is said, "God is not the God of the dead, but of the living".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:131
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:132
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:133
verses.text: ) But this again you say is a riddle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:134
verses.text: Let us therefore solve them both.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:135
verses.text: A man who liveth in pleasure, is dead whilst he liveth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:136
verses.text: For he liveth only to his belly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:137
verses.text: In his other senses he lives not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:138
verses.text: He sees not what he ought to see, he hears not what he ought to hear, he speaks not what he ought to speak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:139
verses.text: Nor does he perform the actions of the living.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:140
verses.text: But as he who is stretched upon a bed, with his eyes closed, and his eyelids fast, perceives nothing that is passing; so it is with this man, or rather not so, but worse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:141
verses.text: For the one is equally insensible to things good and evil, but the latter is sensible to things evil only, but as insensible as the former to things good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:142
verses.text: Thus he is dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:143
verses.text: For nothing relating to the life to come moves or affects him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:144
verses.text: For intemperance, taking him into her own bosom, as into some dark and dismal cavern, full of all uncleanness, causes him to dwell altogether in darkness, like the dead.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:145
verses.text: For when all his time is spent between feasting and drunkenness, is he not dead, and buried in darkness? Even in the morning when he seems to be sober, he is not sober in reality, since he has not yet rid and cleansed himself of yesterday's excess and is still longing for a repetition, and in that his evening and noon he passes in revels, and all the night, and most of the morning in deep sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:146
verses.text: Is he then to be numbered with the living? Who can describe that storm that comes of luxury, that assails his soul and body? For as a sky continually clouded admits not the sunbeams to shine through it, so the fumes of luxury and wine enveloping his brain, as if it were some rock, and casting over it a thick mist, suffer not reason to exert itself, but overspread the drunken man with profound darkness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:147
verses.text: With him who is thus affected, how great must be the storm within, how violent the tumult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:148
verses.text: As when a flood of water has risen, and has surmounted the entrances of the workshops, we see all the inmates in confusion, and using tubs and pitchers and sponges, and many other contrivances to bale it out, that it may not both undermine the building, and spoil all that is contained in it: so it is when luxury overwhelms the soul; its reasonings within are disturbed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:149
verses.text: What is already collected, cannot be discharged, and by the introduction of more, a violent storm is raised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:150
verses.text: For look not at the cheerful and merry countenance, but examine the interior, and you will see it full of deep dejection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:151
verses.text: If it were possible to bring the soul into view, and to behold it with our bodily eyes, that of the luxurious would seem depressed, mournful, miserable, and wasted with leanness; for the more the body grows sleek and gross, the more lean and weakly is the soul; and the more one is pampered, the more is the other hampered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:152
verses.text: As, when the pupil of the eye has the external coats over it too thick, it cannot put forth the power of vision, and look out, because the light is excluded by the thick covering, and darkness often ensues; so when the body is constantly full fed, the soul must be invested with grossness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:153
verses.text: But the dead rot, and are corrupted, you say; and an unwholesome moisture distills from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:154
verses.text: So in her "that liveth in pleasure," may be seen rheums, and phlegm, catarrh, hiccough, vomitings, eructations, and the like, which, as too unseemly, I forbear to name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:155
verses.text: For such is the dominion of luxury, that it makes one endure things, which we do not even think proper to mention.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:156
verses.text: But you still ask, how is the body dissolved whilst it yet eats and drinks? Surely this is no sign of human life, since creatures without reason too eat and drink.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:157
verses.text: Where the soul lies dead, what do eating and drinking avail? The dead body, that is invested with a flowery garment, is not benefited by it, and when a blooming body invests a dead soul, the soul is not benefited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:158
verses.text: For when its whole discourse is of cooks, and caterers, and confectioners, and it utters nothing pious, is it not dead? For let us consider what is man? The Heathens say that he is a rational animal, mortal, capable of intelligence and knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:159
verses.text: But let us not take our definition from them, but whence? From the sacred writings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:160
verses.text: Where then has the Scripture given a definition of man? Hear its words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:161
verses.text: "There was a man perfect and upright, one that feared God, and eschewed evil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:162
verses.text: (Job i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:163
verses.text: ) This was indeed a man! Again, another says, "Man is great, and the merciful man is precious".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:164
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:165
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:166
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:167
verses.text: ) Those who answer not to this description, though they partake of mind, and are never so capable of knowledge, the Scripture refuses to acknowledge them as men, but calls them dogs, and horses, and serpents, and foxes, and wolves, and if there be any animals more contemptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:168
verses.text: If such then is man, he that liveth in pleasure is not a man; for how can he be, who never thinks of anything that he ought? Luxury and sobriety cannot exist together: they are destructive of one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:169
verses.text: Even the Heathens say,  "A heavy paunch bears not a subtle mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:170
verses.text: Such as these the Scripture calls men without souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:171
verses.text: "My Spirit (it is said) shall not always abide in these men, because they are flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:172
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:173
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:174
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:175
verses.text: ) Yet they had a soul, but because it was dead in them, He calls them flesh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:176
verses.text: For as in the case of the virtuous, though they have a body, we say, "he is all soul, he is all spirit," so the reverse is said of those who are otherwise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:177
verses.text: So Paul also said of those, who did not fulfill the works of the flesh, "Ye are not in the flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:178
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:179
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:180
verses.text: ) Thus those who live in luxury are not in the soul or in the spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:181
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:182
verses.text: "She that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:183
verses.text: Hear this, ye women, that pass your time in revels and intemperance, and who neglect the poor, pining and perishing with hunger, whilst you are destroying yourself with continual luxury.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:184
verses.text: Thus you are the causes of two deaths, of those who are dying of want, and of your own, both through ill measure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:185
verses.text: But if out of your fullness you tempered their want, you would save two lives.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:186
verses.text: Why do you thus gorge your own body with excess, and waste that of the poor with want; why pamper this above measure, and stint that too beyond measure? Consider what comes of food, into what it is changed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:187
verses.text: Are you not disgusted at its being named? Why then be eager for such accumulations? The increase of luxury is but the multiplication of dung! For nature has her limits, and what is beyond these is not nourishment, but injury, and the increase of ordure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:188
verses.text: Nourish the body, but do not destroy it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:189
verses.text: Food is called nourishment, to show that its design is not to injure the body, but to nourish it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:190
verses.text: For this reason perhaps food passes into excrement, that we may not be lovers of luxury.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:191
verses.text: For if it were not so, if it were not useless and injurious to the body, we should not cease from devouring one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:192
verses.text: If the belly received as much as it pleased, digested it, and conveyed it to the body, we should see wars and battles innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:193
verses.text: Even now when part of our food passes into ordure, part into blood, part into spurious and useless phlegm, we are nevertheless so addicted to luxury, that we spend perhaps whole estates on a meal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:194
verses.text: What should we not do, if this were not the end of luxury? The more luxuriously we live, the more noisome are the odors with which we are filled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:195
verses.text: The body is like a swollen bottle, running out every way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:196
verses.text: The eructations are such as to pain the head of a bystander.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:197
verses.text: From the heat of fermentation within, vapors are sent forth, as from a furnace, if bystanders are pained, what, think you, is the brain within continually suffering, assailed by these fumes? to say nothing of the channels of the heated and obstructed blood, of those reservoirs, the liver and the spleen, and of the canals by which the faeces are discharged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:198
verses.text: The drains in our streets we take care to keep unobstructed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:199
verses.text: We cleanse our sewers with poles and drags, that they may not be stopped, or overflow, but the canals of our bodies we do not keep clear, but obstruct and choke them up, and when the filth rises to the very throne of the king, I mean the brain, we do not regard it, treating it not like a worthy king, but like an unclean brute.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:200
verses.text: God hath purposely removed to a distance those unclean members, that we might not receive offense from them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:201
verses.text: But we suffer it not to be so, and spoil all by our excess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:202
verses.text: And other evils might be mentioned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:203
verses.text: To obstruct the sewers is to breed a pestilence; but if a stench from without is pestilential, that which is pent up within the body, and cannot find a vent, what disorders must it not produce both to body and soul? Some have strangely complained, wondering why God has ordained that we should bear a load of ordure with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:204
verses.text: But they themselves increase the load.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:205
verses.text: God designed thus to detach us from luxury, and to persuade us not to attach ourselves to worldly things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:206
verses.text: But thou art not thus to be persuaded to cease from gluttony, but though it is but as far as the throat, and as long as the hour of eating, nay not even so long, that the pleasure abides, thou continuest in thine indulgence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:207
verses.text: Is it not true that as soon as it has passed the palate and the throat, the pleasure ceases? For the sense of it is in the taste, and after that is gratified, a nausea succeeds, the stomach not digesting the food, or not without much difficulty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:208
verses.text: Justly then is it said, that "she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:209
verses.text: For the luxurious soul is unable to hear or to see anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:210
verses.text: It becomes weak, ignoble, unmanly, illiberal, cowardly, full of impudence, servility, ignorance, rage, violence, and all kinds of evil, and destitute of the opposite virtues.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:211
verses.text: Therefore he says,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:212
verses.text: "These things give in charge, that they may be blameless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:213
verses.text: He does not leave it to their choice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:214
verses.text: Command them, he says, not to be luxurious, assuming it to be confessedly an evil, as not holding it lawful or admissible for the luxurious to partake of the Holy Mysteries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:215
verses.text: "These things command," he says, "that they may be blameless".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:216
verses.text: Thus you see it is reckoned among sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:217
verses.text: For if it were a matter of choice, though it were left undone, we might still be blameless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:218
verses.text: Therefore in obedience to Paul, let us command the luxurious widow not to have place in the list of widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:219
verses.text: For if a soldier, who frequents the bath, the theater, the busy scenes of life, is judged to desert his duty, much more the widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:220
verses.text: Let us then not seek our rest here, that we may find it hereafter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:221
verses.text: Let us not live in pleasure here, that we may hereafter enjoy true pleasure, true delight, which brings no evil with it, but infinite good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 14:222
verses.text: Of which God grant that we may all be partakers, in Jesus Christ, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:1
verses.text: Homily XIV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:2
verses.text: Timothy v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:3
verses.text: "But if any provide not for his own, and especially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:4
verses.text: Many consider that their own virtue is sufficient for their salvation, and if they duly regulate their own life, that nothing further is wanting to save them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:5
verses.text: But in this they greatly err, which is proved by the example of him who buried his one talent, for he brought it back not diminished but entire, and just as it had been delivered to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:6
verses.text: It is shown also by the blessed Paul, who says here, "If any one provide not for his own".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:7
verses.text: The provision of which he speaks is universal, and relates to the soul as well as the body, since both are to be provided for.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:8
verses.text: "If any provide not for his own, and especially for those of his own house," that is, those who are nearly related to him, "he is worse than an infidel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:9
verses.text: And so says Isaiah, the chief of the Prophets, "Thou shalt not overlook thy kinsmen of thy own seed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:10
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:11
verses.text: lviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:12
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:13
verses.text: ) For if a man deserts those who are united by ties of kindred and affinity, how shall he be affectionate towards others? Will it not have the appearance of vainglory, when benefiting others he slights his own relations, and does not provide for them? And what will be said, if instructing others, he neglects his own, though he has greater facilities; and a higher obligation to benefit them? Will it not be said, These Christians are affectionate indeed, who neglect their own relatives? "He is worse than an infidel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:14
verses.text: Wherefore? Because the latter, if he benefits not aliens, does not neglect his near kindred.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:15
verses.text: What is meant is this: The law of God and of nature is violated by him who provides not for his own family.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:16
verses.text: But if he who provides not for them has denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel, where shall he be ranked who has injured his relatives? With whom shall he be placed? But how has he denied the faith? Even as it is said, "They profess that they know God, but in works they deny Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:17
verses.text: (Tit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:18
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:19
verses.text: ) What has God, in whom they believe, commanded? "Hide not thyself from thine own flesh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:20
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:21
verses.text: lviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:22
verses.text: ) How does he then believe who thus denies God? Let those consider this, who to spare their wealth neglect their kindred.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:23
verses.text: It was the design of God, in uniting us by the ties of kindred, to afford us many opportunities of doing good to one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:24
verses.text: When therefore thou neglectest a duty which infidels perform, hast thou not denied the faith? For it is not faith merely to profess belief, but to do works worthy of faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:25
verses.text: And it is possible in each particular to believe and not to believe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:26
verses.text: For since he had spoken of luxury and self-indulgence, he says that it is not for this only that such a woman is punished, because she is luxurious, but because her luxury compels her to neglect her household.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:27
verses.text: This he says with reason; for she that liveth to the belly, perishes hereby also, as "having denied the faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:28
verses.text: But how is she worse than an infidel? Because it is not the same thing to neglect our kindred, as to neglect a stranger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:29
verses.text: How should it be? But the fault is greater here, to desert one known than one who is unknown to us, a friend than one who is not a friend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:30
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:32
verses.text: "Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:33
verses.text: Well reported of for good works".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:34
verses.text: He had said, "Let them learn first to show piety at home, and to requite their parents".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:35
verses.text: He had also said, "She that liveth in pleasure is dead whilst she liveth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:36
verses.text: He had said, "If she provides not for her own she is worse than an infidel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:37
verses.text: Having mentioned the qualities which not to have would render a woman unworthy to be reckoned among the widows, he now mentions what she ought to have besides.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:38
verses.text: What then? are we to receive her for her years? What merit is there in that? It is not her own doing that she is threescore years old.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:39
verses.text: Therefore he does not speak of her age merely, as, if she has even reached those years, she may not yet, he says, without good works, be reckoned among the number.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:40
verses.text: But why then is he particular about the age? He afterwards assigns a cause not originating with himself, but with the widows themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:41
verses.text: Meanwhile let us hear what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:42
verses.text: "Well reported of for good works, if she have brought up children".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:43
verses.text: Truly, it is no unimportant work to bring up children; but bringing them up is not merely taking care of them; they must be brought up well; as he said before, "If they continue in faith, and charity, and holiness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:44
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:45
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:46
verses.text: ) Observe how constantly he sets kindnesses to our own relatives before those to strangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:47
verses.text: First he says, "If she have brought up children," then, "If she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the Saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:48
verses.text: But what if she be poor? Not even in that case is she debarred from bringing up children, lodging strangers, relieving the afflicted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:49
verses.text: She is not more destitute than the widow who gave the two mites.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:50
verses.text: Poor though she be, she has an house, she does not lodge in the open air.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:51
verses.text: "If," he says, "she have washed the Saints' feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:52
verses.text: This is not a costly work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:53
verses.text: "If she have diligently followed every good work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:54
verses.text: What precept does he give here? He exhorts them to contribute bodily service, for women are peculiarly fitted for such attendance, for making the bed of the sick, and composing them to rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:55
verses.text: Strange! what strictness does he require of widows; almost as much as of the Bishop himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:56
verses.text: For he says, "If she have diligently followed every good work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:57
verses.text: This is as though he meant that, if she could not of herself perform it, she shared and cooperated in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:58
verses.text: When he cuts off luxury, he would have her provident, a good economist, and at the same time continually persevering in prayer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:59
verses.text: Such was Anna.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:60
verses.text: Such strictness does he require of widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:61
verses.text: Greater even than of virgins, from whom he yet requires much strictness, and eminent virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:62
verses.text: For when he speaks of "that which is comely," and "that she may attend upon the Lord without distraction" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:63
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:64
verses.text: ), he gives, in a manner, a summary of all virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:65
verses.text: You see that it is not merely the not contracting a second marriage that is enough to make a widow, many other things are necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:66
verses.text: But why does he discourage second marriages? Is the thing condemned? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:67
verses.text: That is heretical.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:68
verses.text: Only he would have her henceforth occupied in spiritual things, transferring all her care to virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:69
verses.text: For marriage is not an impure state, but one of much occupation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:70
verses.text: He speaks of their having leisure, not of their being more pure by remaining unmarried.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:71
verses.text: For marriage certainly implies much secular engagement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:72
verses.text: If you abstain from marriage that you may have leisure for the service of God, and yet do not so employ that leisure, it is of no advantage to you, (if you do not use your leisure,) to perform all services to strangers, and to the Saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:73
verses.text: If you do not thus, you abstain from marriage not for any good end, but as though you condemned the state.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:74
verses.text: So the virgin, who is not truly crucified to the world, by declining marriage, appears to condemn it as accursed and impure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:75
verses.text: Observe, the hospitality here spoken of is not merely a friendly reception, but one given with zeal and alacrity, with readiness, and going about it as if one were receiving Christ Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:76
verses.text: The widows should perform these services themselves, not commit them to their handmaids.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:77
verses.text: For Christ said, "If I your Master and Lord have washed your feet, ye ought also to wash one another's feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:78
verses.text: (John xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:79
verses.text: ) And though a woman may be very rich, and of the highest rank, vain of her birth and noble family, there is not the same distance between her and others, as between God and the disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:80
verses.text: If thou receivest the stranger as Christ, be not ashamed, but rather glory: but if you receive him not as Christ, receive him not at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:81
verses.text: "He that receiveth you," He said, "receiveth Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:82
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:83
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:84
verses.text: ) If you do not so receive him, you have no reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:85
verses.text: Abraham was receiving men that passed as travelers, as he thought, and he did not leave to his servants to make the preparations for their entertainment, but took the greater part of the service upon himself, and commanded his wife to mix the flour, though he had three hundred and eighteen servants born in his house, of whom there must have been many maidservants; but he wished that himself and his wife should have the reward, not of the cost only, but of the service.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:86
verses.text: Thus ought we ever to exercise hospitality by our own personal exertions, that we may be sanctified, and our hands be blessed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:87
verses.text: And if thou givest to the poor, disdain not thyself to give it, for it is not to the poor that it is given, but to Christ; and who is so wretched, as to disdain to stretch out his own hand to Christ?  This is hospitality, this is truly to do it for God's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:88
verses.text: But if you give orders with pride, though you bid him take the first place, it is not hospitality, it is not done for God's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:89
verses.text: The stranger requires much attendance, much encouragement, and with all this it is difficult for him not to feel abashed; for so delicate is his position, that whilst he receives the favor, he is ashamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:90
verses.text: That shame we ought to remove by the most attentive service, and to show by words and actions, that we do not think we are conferring a favor, but receiving one, that we are obliging less than we are obliged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:91
verses.text: So much does good will multiply the kindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:92
verses.text: For as he who considers himself a loser, and thinks that he is doing a favor, destroys all the merit of it; so he who looks upon himself as receiving a kindness, increases the reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:93
verses.text: "For God loveth a cheerful giver".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:94
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:95
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:96
verses.text: ) So that you are rather indebted to the poor man for receiving your kindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:97
verses.text: For if there were no poor, the greater part of your sins would not be removed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:98
verses.text: They are the healers of your wounds, their hands are medicinal to you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:99
verses.text: The physician, extending his hand to apply a remedy, does not exercise the healing art more than the poor man, who stretches out his hand to receive your alms, and thus becomes a cure for your ills.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:100
verses.text: You give your money, and with it your sins pass away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:101
verses.text: Such were the Priests of old, of whom it was said, "They eat up the sin of My people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:102
verses.text: (Hosea iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:103
verses.text: ) Thus thou receivest more than thou givest, thou art benefited more than thou benefitest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:104
verses.text: Thou lendest to God, not to men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:105
verses.text: Thou increasest thy wealth, rather than diminishest it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:106
verses.text: But if thou dost not lessen it by giving, then it is indeed diminished!  "If she have received strangers, if she have washed the Saints' feet".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:107
verses.text: But who are these? The distressed saints, not any saints whatever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:108
verses.text: For there may be saints, who are much waited on by every one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:109
verses.text: Do not visit these, who are in the enjoyment of plenty, but those who are in tribulation, who are unknown, or known to few.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:110
verses.text: He who hath "done it unto the least of these," He saith, "hath done it unto Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:111
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:112
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:113
verses.text: )  Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:114
verses.text: Give not thy alms to those who preside in the Church to distribute.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:115
verses.text: Bestow it thyself, that thou mayest have the reward not of giving merely, but of kind service.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:116
verses.text: Give with thine own hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:117
verses.text: Cast into the furrow thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:118
verses.text: Here it is not required to handle the plow, to yoke the ox, to wait the season, nor to break up the earth, or to contend with the frost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:119
verses.text: No such trouble is required here, where thou sowest for heaven, where there is no frost nor winter nor any such thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:120
verses.text: Thou sowest in souls, where no one taketh away what is sown, but it is firmly retained with all care and diligence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:121
verses.text: Cast the seed thyself, why deprive thyself of thy reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:122
verses.text: There is great reward in dispensing even what belongs to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:123
verses.text: There is a reward not only for giving, but for dispensing well the things that are given.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:124
verses.text: Why wilt thou not have this reward? For that there is a reward for this, hear how we read that the Apostles appointed Stephen to the ministry of the widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:125
verses.text: (Acts vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:127
verses.text: )  Be thou the dispenser of thine own gifts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:128
verses.text: Thine own benevolence and the fear of God appoint thee to that ministry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:129
verses.text: Thus vainglory is excluded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:130
verses.text: This refreshes the soul, this sanctifies the hands, this pulls down pride.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:131
verses.text: This teaches thee philosophy, this inflames thy zeal, this makes thee to receive blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:132
verses.text: Thy head, as thou departest, receives all the blessings of the widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:133
verses.text: Be more earnest in thy prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:134
verses.text: Inquire diligently for holy men, men that are truly such, who, in the retirement of the desert, cannot beg, but are wholly devoted to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:135
verses.text: Take a long journey to visit them, and give with thine own hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:136
verses.text: For thou mayest profit much in thine own person, if thou givest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:137
verses.text: Dost thou see their tents, their lodging? dost thou see the desert? dost thou see the solitude? Often when thou hast gone to bestow money, thou givest thine whole soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:138
verses.text: Thou art detained, and hast become his fellow-captive, and hast been alike estranged from the world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:139
verses.text: It is of great benefit even to see the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:140
verses.text: "It is better," he saith, "to go to the house of mourning, than to the house of feasting".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:141
verses.text: (Eccles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:142
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:143
verses.text: ) By the latter the soul is inflamed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:144
verses.text: For if thou canst imitate the luxury, then thou art encouraged to self-indulgence, and if thou canst not, thou art grieved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:145
verses.text: In the house of mourning there is nothing of this kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:146
verses.text: If thou canst not afford to be luxurious, thou art not pained; and if thou canst, thou art restrained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:147
verses.text: Monasteries are indeed houses of mourning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:148
verses.text: There is sackcloth and ashes, there is solitude, there is no laughter, no pressure of worldly business.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:149
verses.text: There is fasting, and lying upon the ground; there is no impure savor of rich food, no blood shed, no tumult, no disturbance, or crowding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:150
verses.text: There is a serene harbor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:151
verses.text: They are as lights shining from a lofty place to mariners afar off.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:152
verses.text: They are stationed at the port, drawing all men to their own calm, and preserving from shipwreck those who gaze on them, and not letting those walk in darkness who look thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:153
verses.text: Go to them, and make friends with them, embrace their holy feet, more honorable to touch than the heads of others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:154
verses.text: If some clasp the feet of statues, because they bear but a likeness of the king, wilt thou not clasp his feet who has Christ within him, and be saved? The Saints' feet are holy, though they are poor men, but not even the head of the profane is honorable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:155
verses.text: Such efficacy is there in the feet of the Saints, that when they shake off the dust of their feet, they inflict punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:156
verses.text: When a saint is among us, let us not be ashamed of anything that belongs to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:157
verses.text: And all are saints, who unite a holy life with a right faith and though they do not work miracles nor cast out devils, still they are saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:158
verses.text: Go then to their tabernacles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:159
verses.text: To go to the monastery of a holy man is to pass, as it were, from earth to heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:160
verses.text: Thou seest not there what is seen in a private house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:161
verses.text: That company is free from all impurity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:162
verses.text: There is silence and profound quiet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:163
verses.text: The words "mine and thine" are not in use among them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:164
verses.text: And if thou remainest there a whole day or even two, the more pleasure thou wilt enjoy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:165
verses.text: There, as soon as it is day, or rather before day, the cock crows, and you see it not as you may see it in a house, the servants snoring, the doors shut, all sleeping like the dead, whilst the muleteer without is ringing his bells.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:166
verses.text: There is nothing of all this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:167
verses.text: All, immediately shaking off sleep, reverently rise when their President calls them, and forming themselves into a holy choir, they stand, and lifting up their hands all at once sing the sacred hymns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:168
verses.text: For they are not like us, who require many hours to shake off sleep from our heavy heads.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:169
verses.text: We indeed, as soon as we are waked, sit some time stretching our limbs, go as nature calls, then proceed to wash our face and our hands; afterwards we take our shoes and clothes, and a deal of time is spent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:170
verses.text: It is not so there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:171
verses.text: No one calls for his servant, for each waits upon himself: neither does he require many clothes, nor need to shake off sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:172
verses.text: For as soon as he opens his eyes, he is like one who has been long awake in collectedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:173
verses.text: For when the heart is not stifled within by excess of food, it soon recovers itself, and is immediately wakeful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:174
verses.text: The hands are always pure; for his sleep is composed and regular.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:175
verses.text: No one among them is found snoring or breathing hard, or tossing about in sleep, or with his body exposed; but they lie in sleep as decently as those who are awake, and all this is the effect of the orderly state of their souls.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:176
verses.text: These are truly saints and angels among men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:177
verses.text: And marvel not when you hear these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:178
verses.text: For their great fear of God suffers them not to go down into the depths of sleep, and to drown their minds, but it falls lightly upon them, merely affording them rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:179
verses.text: And as their sleep is, such are their dreams, not full of wild fancies and monstrous visions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:180
verses.text: But, as I said, at the crowing of the cock their President comes, and gently touching the sleeper with his foot, rouses them all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:181
verses.text: For there are none sleeping naked.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:182
verses.text: Then as soon as they have arisen they stand up, and sing the prophetic hymns with much harmony, and well composed tunes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:183
verses.text: And neither harp nor pipe nor other musical instrument utters such sweet melodies, as you hear from the singing of these saints in their deep and quiet solitudes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:184
verses.text: And the songs themselves too are suitable, and full of the love of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:185
verses.text: "In the night," they say, "lift up your hands unto God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:186
verses.text: With my soul have I desired Thee in the night, yea with my spirit within me will I seek Thee early," (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:187
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:188
verses.text: ) And the Psalms of David, that cause fountains of tears to flow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:189
verses.text: For when he sings, "I am weary with my groaning, all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:190
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:191
verses.text: ): and, again, "I have eaten ashes like bread".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:192
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:193
verses.text: cii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:194
verses.text: ) "What is man that thou art mindful of him?" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:195
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:196
verses.text: ) "Man is like to vanity, his days are as a shadow that passeth away".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:197
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:198
verses.text: cxliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:199
verses.text: ) "Be not afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:200
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:201
verses.text: ); and, "Who maketh men to be of one mind in a house" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:202
verses.text: lxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:203
verses.text: ): and, "Seven times a day do I praise Thee, because of Thy righteous judgments" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:204
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:205
verses.text: ): and, "At midnight will I rise to give thanks unto Thee, because of Thy righteous judgments" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:206
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:207
verses.text: ): and, "God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:208
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:209
verses.text: ): and, "Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for Thou art with me" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:210
verses.text: xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:211
verses.text: ): and, "I will not be afraid for the terror by night, nor for the arrow that flieth by day, nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness, nor for the destruction that wasteth at noonday" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:212
verses.text: xci.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:214
verses.text: ): and, "We are counted as sheep for the slaughter" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:215
verses.text: xliv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:216
verses.text: ): he expresses their ardent love to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:217
verses.text: And again, when they sing with the Angels, (for Angels too are singing then,) "Praise ye the Lord from the Heavens".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:218
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:219
verses.text: cxlviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:220
verses.text: ) And we meanwhile are snoring, or scratching our heads, or lying supine meditating endless deceits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:221
verses.text: Think what it was for them to spend the whole night in this employment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:222
verses.text: And when the day is coming on, they take rest again; for when we begin our works, they have a season of rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:223
verses.text: But each of us, when it is day, calls upon his neighbor, takes account of his outgoings, then goes into the forum; trembling he appears before the magistrate, and dreads a reckoning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:224
verses.text: Another visits the stage, another goes about his own business.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:225
verses.text: But these holy men, having performed their morning prayers and hymns, proceed to the reading of the Scriptures.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:226
verses.text: There are some too that have learned to write out books, each having his own apartment assigned to him, where he lives in perpetual quiet; no one is trifling, not one speaks a word.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:227
verses.text: Then at the third, sixth, and ninth hours, and in the evening, they perform their devotions, having divided the day into four parts, and at the conclusion of each they honor God with psalms and hymns, and whilst others are dining, laughing, and sporting, and bursting with gluttony, they are occupied with their hymns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:228
verses.text: For they have no time for the table nor for these things of sense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:229
verses.text: After their meal they again pursue the same course, having previously given themselves a while to sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:230
verses.text: The men of the world sleep during the day: but these watch during the night.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:231
verses.text: Truly children of light are they! And while the former, having slept away the greater part of the day, go forth oppressed with heaviness, these are still collected, remaining without food till the evening, and occupied in hymns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:232
verses.text: Other men, when evening overtakes them, hasten to the baths, and different recreations, but these, being relieved from their labors, then betake themselves to their table, not calling up a multitude of servants, nor throwing the house into bustle and confusion, nor setting before them high-seasoned dishes, and rich-steaming viands, but some only partaking of bread and salt, to which others add oil, whilst the weakly have also herbs and pulse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:233
verses.text: Then after sitting a short time, or rather after concluding all with hymns, they each go to rest upon a bed made for repose only and not for luxury.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:234
verses.text: There is no dread of magistrates, no lordly arrogance, no terror of slaves, no disturbance of women or children, no multitudes of chests, or superfluous laying by of garments, no gold or silver, no guards and sentinels, no storehouse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:235
verses.text: Nothing of all these, but all there is full of prayer, of hymns, and of a spiritual savor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:236
verses.text: Nothing carnal is there.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:237
verses.text: They fear no attacks of robbers, having nothing of which they can be deprived, no wealth, but a soul and body, of which if they are robbed, it is not a loss but a gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:238
verses.text: For it is said, "To me to live is Christ, and to die is gain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:239
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:240
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:241
verses.text: ) They have freed themselves from all bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:242
verses.text: Truly, "The voice of gladness is in the tabernacles of the righteous".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:243
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:244
verses.text: cxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:245
verses.text: )  There is no such thing to be heard there as wailing and lamentation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:246
verses.text: Their roof is free from that melancholy and those cries.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:247
verses.text: Deaths happen there indeed, for their bodies are not immortal, but they know not death, as death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:248
verses.text: The departed are accompanied to the grave with hymns.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:249
verses.text: This they call a procession, not a burial; and when it is reported that any one is dead, great is their cheerfulness, great their pleasure; or rather not one of them can bear to say that one is dead, but that he is perfected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:250
verses.text: Then there is thanksgiving, and great glory, and joy, every one praying that such may be his own end, that so his own combat may terminate, and he may rest from his labor and struggles, and may see Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:251
verses.text: And if any is sick, instead of tears and lamentations they have recourse to prayers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:252
verses.text: Often not the care of physicians, but faith alone relieves the sick.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:253
verses.text: And if a physician be necessary, then too there is the greatest firmness and philosophy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:254
verses.text: There is no wife tearing her hair, nor children bewailing their orphan state before the time, nor slaves entreating the dying man to give them an assurance that they shall be committed to good hands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:255
verses.text: Escaping from all these, the soul looks but to one thing at its last breath, that it may depart in favor with God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:256
verses.text: And if disease occurs, the causes of it are matter of glory rather than of reproach, as in other cases.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:257
verses.text: For it proceeds not from gluttony nor fullness of the head, but from intense watchfulness and fasting, or the like causes; and hence it is easily removed, for it is sufficient for its removal to abate the severity of these exercises.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:258
verses.text: Tell me then, you will say, whether any one could wash the Saints' feet in the Church? Whether such are to be found among us? Yes: undoubtedly they are such.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:259
verses.text: Let us not, however, when the life of these saints is described despise those that are in the Churches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:260
verses.text: There are many such often among us, though they are in secret.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:261
verses.text: Nor let us despise them, because they go from house to house, or go into the forum, or stand forth in public.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:262
verses.text: God hath even commanded such services, saying, "Judge the fatherless, plead for the widow".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:263
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:264
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:265
verses.text: ) Many are the ways of being virtuous, as there are many varieties of jewels, though all are called jewels; one is bright and round on all sides, another has some different beauty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:266
verses.text: And how is this? As coral has, by a kind of art, its line extended, and its angles shaped off, and another color more delicious than white, and the prasius above every green, another has the rich color of blood, another an azure surpassing the sea, another is more brilliant than the purple, and thus rivaling in their varieties all the colors of flowers or of the sun.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:267
verses.text: Yet all are called jewels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:268
verses.text: So it is with the Saints.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:269
verses.text: Some discipline themselves, some the Churches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:270
verses.text: Paul therefore has well said, "If she have washed the Saints' feet, if she have relieved the afflicted".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:271
verses.text: For he speaks thus, that he may excite us all to imitation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:272
verses.text: Let us hasten then to perform such actions, that we may be able hereafter to boast that we have washed the Saints' feet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:273
verses.text: For if we ought to wash their feet, much more ought we to give them our money with our own hands, and at the same time study to be concealed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:274
verses.text: "Let not thy left hand know," He says, "what thy right hand doeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:275
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:276
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:277
verses.text: )  Why takest thou so many witnesses? Let not thy servant know it, nor, if possible, thy wife.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:278
verses.text: Many are the impediments of the deceitful one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:279
verses.text: Often she who never before interfered, will impede such works, either from vainglory, or some other motive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:280
verses.text: Even Abraham, who had an admirable wife, when he was about to offer up his son, concealed it from her, though he knew not what was to happen, but was fully persuaded that he must slaughter his son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:281
verses.text: What then, would any one that was but an ordinary man have said? Would it not be, "Who is this that perpetrates such acts?" Would he not have accused him of cruelty and brutality? His wife was not even allowed to see her son, to receive his last words, to witness his dying struggles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:282
verses.text: But he led him away like a captive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:283
verses.text: That just man though not of any such thing, inebriated as he was with zeal, so that he looked only how to fulfill that which was commanded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:284
verses.text: No servant, no wife was present, nay, he himself knew not what would be the issue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:285
verses.text: But intent upon offering up a pure victim, he would not defile it with tears, or with any opposition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:286
verses.text: Mark too with what gentleness Isaac asks, "Behold the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?": and what was the father's answer? "My son, God will provide Himself a lamb for a burnt offering".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:287
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:288
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:290
verses.text: ) In this he uttered a prophecy that God would provide Himself a burnt offering in His Son, and it also came true at the time.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:291
verses.text: But why did he conceal it from him who was to be sacrificed? Because he feared lest he should be astounded, lest he should prove unworthy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:292
verses.text: With such care and prudence did he act throughout this affair! Well then hath the Scripture said, "Let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:293
verses.text: If we have one dear to us as one of our own members, let us not be anxious to show to him our charitable works, unless it be necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:294
verses.text: For many evils may arise from it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:295
verses.text: A man is excited to vainglory, and impediments are often raised.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 15:296
verses.text: For this reason let us conceal it, if possible, from our own selves, that we may attain the blessings promised, through the grace and lovingkindness of Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom, &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:1
verses.text: Homily XV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:2
verses.text: Timothy v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:3
verses.text: –  "But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry; having condemnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:4
verses.text: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:5
verses.text: I will therefore that the younger widows marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:6
verses.text: For some are already turned aside after Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:7
verses.text: Paul having discoursed much concerning widows, and having settled the age at which they were to be admitted, saying, "Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old," and having described the qualifications of a widow, "If she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the Saints' feet," proceeds now to say, "But the younger widows refuse".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:8
verses.text: But concerning virgins, though the case of their falling is a much more gross one, he has said nothing of this kind, and rightly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:9
verses.text: For they had enrolled themselves on higher views, and the work with them proceeded from a greater elevation of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:10
verses.text: Therefore the receiving of strangers, and the washing of the Saints' feet, he has represented by "attending upon the Lord without distraction" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:11
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:13
verses.text: ), and by saying, "The unmarried careth for the things that belong to the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:14
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:15
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:17
verses.text: ) And if he has not limited a particular age for them, it is most likely because that point is settled by what he has said in this case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:18
verses.text: But indeed, as I said, the choice of virginity proceeded from a higher purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:19
verses.text: Besides, in this case there had been falls, and thus they had given occasion for his rule, but nothing of that kind had occurred among the virgins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:20
verses.text: For that some had already fallen away is plain, in that he says, "When they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry"; and again, "For some have already turned aside after Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:21
verses.text: "The younger widows refuse, for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry"; that is, when they have become scornful and luxurious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:22
verses.text: For as in the case of a just man, we might say, "Let her depart, for she has become another's".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:23
verses.text: He shows therefore that though they chose widowhood, it was not the choice of their judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:24
verses.text: So then a widow, by the state of widowhood, is espoused to Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:25
verses.text: For He has said, "I am the defender of the widows and the father of the orphans".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:26
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:27
verses.text: lxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:28
verses.text: ) He shows that they do not choose widowhood as they ought, but wax wanton: however he bears with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:29
verses.text: Elsewhere indeed he says, "I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:30
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:31
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:32
verses.text: ) After having given their names to Him, "they will marry," he says, "having condemnation, because they have cast off their first faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:33
verses.text: By faith he means, fidelity to their covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:34
verses.text: As if he had said, They have been false to Christ, they have dishonored Him, and transgressed His covenant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:35
verses.text: "And withal they learn to be idle".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:36
verses.text: Thus he commands not only men, but women also, to work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:37
verses.text: For idleness is the teacher of every sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:38
verses.text: And not only are they exposed to this condemnation, but to other sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:39
verses.text: If therefore it is unbecoming for a married woman "to go from house to house," much more is it for a virgin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:40
verses.text: "And not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:41
verses.text: I will therefore that the younger widows marry, bear children, guide the house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:42
verses.text: What then happens, when the care for the husband is withdrawn, and the care to please God does not constrain them? They naturally become idlers, tattlers, and busybodies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:43
verses.text: For he who does not attend to his own concerns will be meddling with those of others, even as he who minds his own business will take no account of and have no care about the affairs of another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:44
verses.text: And nothing is so unbecoming to a woman, as to busy herself in the concerns of others, and it is no less unbecoming to a man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:45
verses.text: This is a great sign of impudence and forwardness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:46
verses.text: "I will therefore," he says, (since they themselves wish it,) "that the younger widows marry, bear children, guide the house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:47
verses.text: This course is at least preferable to the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:48
verses.text: They ought indeed to be concerned for the things of God, they ought to preserve their faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:49
verses.text: But since they do not this, it is better to avoid a worse course.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:50
verses.text: God is not dishonored by their marrying again, and they do not fall into those practices, which have been censured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:51
verses.text: From such a widowhood, no good could arise, but good may come out of this marriage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:52
verses.text: Hence the women will be able to correct that indolence and vanity of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:53
verses.text: But why, since some have fallen away, does he not say that much care is to be taken of them, that they may not fall into the error he has mentioned? Why has he commanded them to marry? Because marriage is not forbidden, and it is a safeguard to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:54
verses.text: Wherefore he adds, that they "give none occasion," or handle, "to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:55
verses.text: For some are already turned aside after Satan".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:56
verses.text: Such widows as these then he would have refused, not meaning that there should be no younger widows, but that there should be no adulteresses, that none should be idle, busy-bodies, speaking things that they ought not, that no occasion should be given to the adversary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:57
verses.text: Had nothing of this kind taken place, he would not have forbidden them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:58
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:59
verses.text: "If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the Church be charged, that it may relieve them that are widows indeed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:60
verses.text: Observe how again he speaks of those as "widows indeed," who are left destitute, and have no resource from any other quarter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:61
verses.text: It was better to have it so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:62
verses.text: For thus two great objects were attained.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:63
verses.text: Those had an opportunity of doing good, whilst these were honorably maintained, and the Church not burdened.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:64
verses.text: And he has well said, "If any believer".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:65
verses.text: For it is not fit that believing women should be maintained by unbelievers, lest they should seem to stand in need of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:66
verses.text: And observe how persuasively he speaks; he has not said, "let them maintain them expensively," but "let them relieve them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:67
verses.text: "That the Church," he says, "may relieve them that are widows indeed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:68
verses.text: She therefore has the reward of this help also, for she that helps the Church, helps not her only, but those widows too whom the Church is thus enabled to maintain more bountifully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:69
verses.text: "I will therefore that the younger widows"—do what? live in luxury and pleasure? By no means; but—"marry, bear children, guide the house".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:70
verses.text: That he may not be supposed to encourage them to live luxuriously, he adds, that they give no occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:71
verses.text: They ought indeed to have been superior to the things of this world, but since they are not, let them abide in them at least upright.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:72
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:74
verses.text: "Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially they who labor in the word and doctrine.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:75
verses.text: For the Scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:76
verses.text: And, The laborer is worthy of his reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:77
verses.text: The "honor" of which he here speaks is attention to them, and the supply of their necessities, as is shown by his adding, "Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn" (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:78
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:79
verses.text: ); and, "The laborer is worthy of his reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:80
verses.text: (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:81
verses.text: ) So when he says, "Honor widows," he means, "support" them in all that is necessary.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:82
verses.text: Thus he says, "That it may relieve those that are widows indeed"; and again, "Honor widows that are widows indeed," that is, who are in poverty, for the greater their poverty, the more truly are they widows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:83
verses.text: He alleges the Law, he alleges the words of Christ, both agreeing herein.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:84
verses.text: For the Law says, "Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:85
verses.text: See how he would have the teacher labor! For there is not, indeed there is not, any other labor such as his.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:86
verses.text: But this is from the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:87
verses.text: But how does he quote from Christ? "The laborer is worthy of his reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:88
verses.text: Let us not then look only to the reward, but to the terms of the commandment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:89
verses.text: "The laborer," he says, "is worthy of his reward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:90
verses.text: So that if any one lives in sloth and luxury, he is unworthy of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:91
verses.text: Unless he is as the ox treading out the corn, and bearing the yoke, in spite of heat and thorns, and ceases not till he has carried the corn into the granary, he is not worthy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:92
verses.text: Therefore to teachers should be granted a supply of their necessities without grudging, that they may not faint nor be discouraged, nor by attention to inferior things deprive themselves of greater; that they may labor for spiritual things, paying no regard to worldly things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:93
verses.text: It was thus with the Levites; they had no worldly concerns, because the laity took care to provide for them, and their revenues were appointed by the law, as tythes, offerings of gold, first-fruits, vows, and many other things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:94
verses.text: And the law properly assigned these things to them, as seeking things present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:95
verses.text: But I shall say no more than that those who preside ought to have food and raiment, that they may not be distracted by care for these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:96
verses.text: But what is double support? Double that of the widows, or of the deacons, or simply, liberal support.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:97
verses.text: Let us not then think only of the double maintenance granted them, but of what is added, "Those who rule well".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:98
verses.text: And what is it to rule well? Let us hear Christ, Who says, "The good shepherd giveth his life for his sheep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:99
verses.text: (John x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:100
verses.text: ) Thus to rule well is, from our concern for them, never to spare ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:101
verses.text: "Especially those who labor in the word and doctrine".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:102
verses.text: Where then are those who say that there is no occasion for the word and doctrine? Whereas he says to Timothy, "Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them"; and, "Give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine; for in doing this thou shalt save both thyself, and them that hear thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:103
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:104
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:106
verses.text: ) These are the men whom he wishes to be honored most of all, and he adds the reason, for they sustain great labor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 16:107
