verses.text: Behold, these have heard Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:21
verses.text: (John xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:22
verses.text: ) He may mean this, or that when asked, "Art thou the Son of God?" He answered, "Thou sayest, that I am (the Son of God)".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:23
verses.text: (Luke xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:24
verses.text: ) And many other testimonies and confessions did He make.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:25
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:26
verses.text: "That thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:27
verses.text: That is, till thy end, thy departure hence, though he does not so express it, but that he may the more arouse him, says, "till His appearing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:28
verses.text: But what is "to keep the commandment without spot"? To contract no defilement, either of doctrine or of life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:29
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:30
verses.text: "Which in His times He shall show, Who is the blessed and only Potentate, King of kings, and Lord of lords, Who only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:31
verses.text: Of whom are these things said? Of the Father, or of the Son? Of the Son, undoubtedly: and it is said for the consolation of Timothy, that he may not fear nor stand in awe of the kings of the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:32
verses.text: "In His times," that is, the due and fitting times, that he may not be impatient, because it has not yet come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:33
verses.text: And whence is it manifest, that He will show it? Because He is the Potentate, the "only Potentate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:34
verses.text: He then will show it, Who is "blessed," nay blessedness itself; and this is said, to show that in that appearing there is nothing painful or uneasy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:35
verses.text: But he says, "only," either in contradistinction to men, or because He was unoriginated, or as we sometimes speak of a man whom we wish to extol.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:36
verses.text: "Who only hath immortality".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:37
verses.text: What then? hath not the Son immortality? Is He not immortality itself? How should not He, who is of the same substance with the Father, have immortality?  "Dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:38
verses.text: Is He then Himself one Light, and is there another in which He dwells? is He then circumscribed by place? Think not of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:39
verses.text: By this expression is represented the Incomprehensibleness of the Divine Nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:40
verses.text: Thus he speaks of God, in the best way he is able.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:41
verses.text: Observe, how when the tongue would utter something great, it fails in power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:42
verses.text: "Whom no man hath seen nor can see".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:43
verses.text: As, indeed, no one hath seen the Son, nor can see Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:44
verses.text: "To whom be honor and power everlasting, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:45
verses.text: Thus properly, and much to the purpose, has he spoken of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:46
verses.text: For as he had called Him to witness, he speaks much of that Witness, that his disciple may be in the greater awe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:47
verses.text: In these terms he ascribes glory to Him, and this is all we can do, or say.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:48
verses.text: We must not enquire too curiously, who He is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:49
verses.text: If power everlasting is His, fear not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:50
verses.text: Yea though now it take not place, to Him is honor, to Him is power evermore.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:51
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:52
verses.text: "Charge them that are rich in this world that they be not high-minded".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:53
verses.text: He has well said, "rich in this world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:54
verses.text: For there are others rich in the future world.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:55
verses.text: And this advice he gives, knowing that nothing so generally produces pride and arrogance as wealth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:56
verses.text: To abate this, therefore, he immediately adds, "Nor trust in uncertain riches"; since that was the source of pride; inasmuch as he who hopes in God, is not elated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:57
verses.text: Why dost thou place thy hopes upon what is instantly transferable? For such is wealth! and why hopest thou on that of which thou canst not be confident? But you say, how can they avoid being high-minded? By considering the instability and uncertainty of riches, and that hope in God is infinitely more valuable; God being the Author of wealth itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:58
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:59
verses.text: "But in the living God," he says, "who giveth us richly all things to enjoy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:60
verses.text: This "all things richly" is justly spoken, in reference to the changes of the year, to air, light, water, and other gifts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:61
verses.text: For how richly and ungrudgingly are all these bestowed! If thou seekest riches, seek those that are stable and enduring, and which are the fruit of good works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:62
verses.text: He shows that this is his meaning by what follows.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:63
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:64
verses.text: "That they do good," he says, "that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:65
verses.text: The first phrase refers to wealth, the second to charity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:66
verses.text: For to be willing to communicate, implies that they are sociable and kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:67
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:68
verses.text: "Laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:69
verses.text: There nothing is uncertain, for the foundation being firm, there is no instability, all is firm, fixed, immovable, fast, and enduring.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:70
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:71
verses.text: "That they may lay hold," he says, "on eternal life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:72
verses.text: For the doing of good works can secure the enjoyment of eternal life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:73
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:74
verses.text: "O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:75
verses.text: Let it not suffer diminution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:76
verses.text: It is not thy own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:77
verses.text: Thou art intrusted with the property of another, do not lessen it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:78
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:79
verses.text: "Avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:80
verses.text: Well did he thus call it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:81
verses.text: For where there is not faith, there is not knowledge; when anything springs from our reasonings, it is not knowledge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:82
verses.text: Or perhaps he says this, because some then assumed the name of Gnostics, as knowing more than others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:83
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:84
verses.text: "Which some professing have erred concerning the faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:85
verses.text: You see how again he commands Timothy not even to meet them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:86
verses.text: "Avoiding opposition".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:87
verses.text: There are therefore oppositions to which we ought not to vouchsafe an answer, because they turn men from faith, and do not suffer one to be firmly established or fixed in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:88
verses.text: Let us not then pursue this science, but adhere to faith, that unshaken rock.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:89
verses.text: For neither floods nor winds assailing will be able to harm us, since we stand on the rock immovable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:90
verses.text: Thus even in this life, if we choose Him, Who is truly the foundation, we stand, and no harm assails us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:91
verses.text: For what can hurt him who hath chosen the riches, the honor, the glory, the pleasure of the life to come? They are all firm, in them there is no variableness; all things here subject to reverse, and are for ever changing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:92
verses.text: For what wouldest thou have? glory? The Psalmist says, "His glory shall not descend after him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:93
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:94
verses.text: xlix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:95
verses.text: ) And often it abides not with him whilst he lives.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:96
verses.text: But it is not so with virtue, all things which pertain to her are permanent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:97
verses.text: Here, he who obtains glory from his office, upon another succeeding to his office, becomes a private man and inglorious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:98
verses.text: The rich man is reduced to poverty by the attack of robbers, or the snares of sycophants and knaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:99
verses.text: It is not so with Christians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:100
verses.text: The temperate man, if he take heed to himself, will not be robbed of his virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:101
verses.text: He who rules himself, cannot become a common man and a subject.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:102
verses.text: And that this rule is superior to any other, will appear upon examination.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:103
verses.text: For of what advantage, tell me, is it to reign over nations of our fellow-men, and to be the slaves of our own passions? Or what are we the worse for having no one under our rule, if we are superior to the tyranny of the passions? That indeed is Freedom, that is Rule, that is Royalty and Sovereignty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:104
verses.text: The contrary is slavery, though a man be invested with countless diadems.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:105
verses.text: For when a multitude of masters sway him from within, the love of money, the love of pleasure, and anger, and other passions, what avails his diadem? The tyranny of those passions is more severe, when not even his crown has power to deliver him from their subjection.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:106
verses.text: As if one who had been a king should be reduced to slavery by barbarians, and they wishing to show their power the more absolutely, should not strip him of his purple robe and his diadem, but oblige him to work in them, and to perform all menial offices, to draw water, and to cook their food, that his disgrace and their honor might be the more apparent: so do our passions domineer over us more barbarously than any barbarians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:107
verses.text: For he that despises them can despise the barbarians too; but he that submits to them, will suffer more severely than from barbarians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:108
verses.text: The barbarian, when his power prevails, may afflict the body, but these passions torture the soul, and lacerate it all over.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:109
verses.text: When the barbarian has prevailed, he delivers one to temporal death, but these to that which is to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:110
verses.text: So that he alone is the free man, who has his freedom in himself; and he who submits to these unreasonable passions, is the slave.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:111
verses.text: No master, however inhuman, imposes such severe and inhuman commands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:112
verses.text: They say to him, in effect, "Disgrace thy soul without end or object,—offend thy God,—be deaf to the claims of nature; though it be thy father or thy mother, be not ashamed to set thyself against them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:113
verses.text: Such are the commands of avarice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:114
verses.text: "Sacrifice to me, she says, not calves, but men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:115
verses.text: The prophet indeed says, "Sacrifice men, for the calves have failed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:116
verses.text: (Hosea xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:117
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:118
verses.text: ) But avarice says, "Sacrifice men, though there are yet calves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:119
verses.text: Sacrifice those who have never injured thee, yea slay them, though they have been thy benefactors".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:120
verses.text: Or again, "Be at war, and go about as the common enemy of all, of nature herself, and of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:121
verses.text: Heap up gold, not that thou mayest enjoy it, but that thou mayest keep it, and work greater torture to thyself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:122
verses.text: For it is not possible that the lover of money should be able to enjoy it, since he fears lest his gold should be diminished, lest his hoards should fail.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:123
verses.text: "Be watchful," it says, "be suspicious of every one, even domestics and friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:124
verses.text: Have an eye to the goods of other men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:125
verses.text: Though you see the poor man perishing with hunger, give him nothing; but strip him, if it be possible, even of his skin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:126
verses.text: Break thine oaths, lie, swear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:127
verses.text: Be an accuser, a false informer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:128
verses.text: Refuse not, if it be necessary, to rush into fire, to submit to a thousand deaths, to perish with hunger, to struggle with disease".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:129
verses.text: Does not avarice impose these laws? "Be offensive and impudent, shameless and bold, villainous and wicked, ungrateful, unfeeling, unfriendly, faithless, devoid of affection, a parricide, a beast rather than a man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:130
verses.text: Surpass the serpent in bitterness, the wolf in rapacity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:131
verses.text: Exceed in brutality even the beast, nay should it be necessary to proceed even to the malignity of the devil, refuse not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:132
verses.text: Be a stranger to thy benefactor".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:133
verses.text: Does not avarice say all this, and is it not listened to? God on the contrary says, Be a friend to all, be gentle, beloved by all, give offense causelessly to no one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:134
verses.text: "Honor thy father and thy mother".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:135
verses.text: Win an honorable reputation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:136
verses.text: Be not a man, but an angel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:137
verses.text: Utter nothing immodest, nothing false, nor even think of it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:138
verses.text: Relieve the poor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:139
verses.text: Bring not trouble on thyself, by ravaging others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:140
verses.text: Be not bold nor insolent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:141
verses.text: God says this, but no one hearkens.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:142
verses.text: Is not hell then justly threatened, and the fire, and the worm that dieth not? How long are we thus to thrust ourselves down the precipice? How long are we to walk upon thorns, and pierce ourselves with nails, and be grateful for it? We subject ourselves to cruel tyrants, and refuse the gentle Master, who imposes nothing grievous, nor barbarous, nor burdensome, nor unprofitable, but all things such as are useful, and valuable, and beneficial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:143
verses.text: Let us then arouse ourselves, and be self-collected, and gather our forces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On 1 Timothy 19:144
verses.text: Let us love God as we ought, that we may obtain the blessings promised to those that love Him, through the grace and mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, to the Father, &c.
